title: WHY DID ISKCON MUMBAI GBC DEVIATE EN MASSE? | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.text: Hare Krishna, Vishwaguru, Srila Prabhupada ki jai.
Srila Prabhupada started ISKCON in 1966 by formally registering it as a legal entity in New York, United States.
As Srila Prabhupada expanded ISKCON over the next four years, opening 34 branches in that short span of time by the year 1970,
Srila Prabhupada decided to adopt his Guru Maharaj, Srila Bhakti Siddhanta Saraswati Goswami Maharaj's vision of running the organization through a GBC body even after his disappearance.
Srila Prabhupada wrote about this in his letter to Rupanuga dated 28th of April 1974 thus,
In the latter days of my Guru Maharaj, he was very disturbed.
Actually, he left this world earlier.
Otherwise, he would have continued to live for more years.

He never recommended anyone to be the Acharya of the Gaudiya Mutt.
But Sridhar Maharaj is responsible for disobeying this order of Guru Maharaj and he and two others who are already dead unnecessarily thought that there must be one Acharya.
If Guru Maharaj could have seen someone who was qualified at that time to be Acharya, he would have mentioned.
Because on the night before he passed away, he talked of so many things but never mentioned an Acharya.
His idea was, Acharya was not to be nominated amongst the governing body.
He said openly, you make a GBC and conduct the mission.
So, his idea was, amongst the members of the GBC, who would come out successful, a self-effulgent Acharya would be automatically selected.
So, Srila Prabhupada.

those who forget history are condemned to repeat it. The GBC should fulfill its responsibility
of properly governing ISKCON.
By removing all the deviations and reverting to the systems that Srila Prabhupada instituted
originally, the Rithvik system of initiations, the method of deity worship in offering everything
to the Diksha Guru first, rolling back the book changes, etc. Then the GBC will be truly
performing its role of governance up to the expectations of Srila Prabhupada and all the
devotees in ISKCON. Hare Krishna, Vishwaguru Srila Prabhupada ki jai.
